intro: Lygodesmia grandiflora var. dianthopsis, commonly known as the pink-flowered lygodesmia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This variant is distinguished by its larger, showier flowers compared to the typical form of Lygodesmia grandiflora.
